HTML Codegen
  • API Reference
  • View page source

API Reference

Этот раздел содержит полную документацию по API библиотеки HTML Codegen.

Основные модули

Модули библиотеки HTML Codegen:

  • html_codegen.core - Основные классы для работы с HTML узлами

  • html_codegen.renderer - Классы для рендеринга HTML документов

  • html_codegen.tags - Коллекция HTML тегов по категориям

Модуль core

Основные классы для работы с HTML узлами и документами.

Core HTML node classes for creating hierarchical HTML document structures.

This module contains the HTMLNode and HTML classes for building HTML document trees. HTMLNode represents a tree node, while HTML is an HTML element that inherits from HTMLNode. The code includes methods for adding nodes, determining parent elements and root, as well as saving HTML documents to files.

The HTMLNode class also implements a context manager that creates code blocks using the with operator. When an HTMLNode instance is created inside a with block, it is added to the context stack of the current execution context. When exiting the with block, all elements of the current context are added as child elements to the current HTMLNode instance if they don’t have a parent element. The HTMLNode context manager allows creating hierarchical element structures in HTML documents using with blocks.

The HTML class also allows dynamic creation of child elements through method calls with tag names.

class html_codegen.core.HTMLNode[source]

Bases: object

HTMLNode - base class for all HTML tree nodes.

This class provides the fundamental structure for building hierarchical HTML documents. It supports context management for clean code organization and thread-safe operations.

_parent

Parent node of the current HTML node.

Type:

Optional[HTMLNode]

_nodes

List of child nodes of the current HTML node.

Type:

list[HTMLNode]

Bases: tuple

Alias for field number 1

Alias for field number 0

property parent: HTMLNode | None

Getter method for obtaining the parent node of the current HTML node.

Returns:

Parent node of the current HTML node.

Return type:

Optional[HTMLNode]

parent_setted_callback()[source]

Callback method called when parent is set.

If the node was created in a with context, the callback is deferred until the with block exits. Otherwise, it’s executed immediately.

property layer: int

Getter method for obtaining the level of the current HTML node.

Returns:

Level of the current HTML node.

Return type:

int

class html_codegen.core.HTML(tag_name: str, attrs: dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: HTMLNode

HTML - class representing an HTML element.

This class extends HTMLNode to provide HTML-specific functionality including tag names, attributes, and dynamic child element creation.

tag_name

Tag name of the element

Type:

str

is_single

Flag indicating whether the element is single (e.g., <img>)

Type:

bool

is_text

Flag indicating whether the element is text

Type:

bool

_attrs

Dictionary of element attributes

Type:

dict

parent

Parent element

Type:

HTML

root

Root element

Type:

HTML

_nodes

List of child elements

Type:

list

__getattr__(tag_name: str) → Callable[source]

Return a function that creates a new HTML element with the specified tag name.

For tags that conflict with Python keywords (input, object, map, del), automatically searches for a version with underscore (input_, object_, map_, del_).

Parameters:

tag_name (str) – Tag name

Returns:

Function that creates a new HTML element

Return type:

Callable

property in_head: bool

Check if the element is inside a head tag.

Returns:

Return type:

Модуль renderer

Классы для рендеринга HTML документов.

HTML rendering engine for converting HTML node trees to formatted HTML strings.

This module provides the Renderer class which handles the conversion of HTML node structures into properly formatted HTML markup with indentation and structure.

class html_codegen.renderer.Renderer(tag: HTML, html_indent: int = 2)[source]

Bases: object

HTML renderer for converting HTML node trees to formatted HTML strings.

This class handles the conversion of HTML node structures into properly formatted HTML markup with customizable indentation.

tag

The HTML node to render

Type:

HTML

html_indent

Number of spaces for indentation (default: 2)

Type:

int

_is_root

Whether this tag is the root of the document

Type:

bool

__init__(tag: HTML, html_indent: int = 2) → None[source]

Initialize the renderer with an HTML tag and indentation settings.

Parameters:

  • tag (HTML) – The HTML node to render

  • html_indent (int) – Number of spaces for indentation (default: 2)

render() → str[source]

Render the HTML tag and its children to a formatted HTML string.

Returns:

Formatted HTML string

Return type:

str

Модуль tags

Коллекция HTML тегов, организованных по категориям.

HTML tags organized by logical modules.

This module provides a comprehensive collection of HTML5 tags organized into logical categories for easy import and use. All tags are implemented as classes that inherit from base tag classes and provide proper HTML semantics.

Categories: - Base classes and mixins - Document structure tags - Semantic HTML5 tags - Text formatting tags - List tags - Table tags - Form tags - Media tags - Metadata tags - Interactive elements

class html_codegen.tags.text(text: str, /)[source]

Bases: HTML

This class represents a text node in HTML. It inherits from the HTML class.

Indicates whether this node is a text node.

Type:

bool

text (str) – Text that will be set for this node.

Check if a new HTML element can be added as a child element.

Parameters:

new_node (HTMLNode) – New HTML element

Raises:

Exception – If the new element already has a parent

class html_codegen.tags.OnlyOneInHTMLTagMixin[source]

Bases: object

Mixin class that ensures a tag can only appear once within an HTML document.

This mixin validates that the tag is placed inside an HTML tag and that no other instance of the same tag already exists in the document.

tag_name: str
parent: HTML
class html_codegen.tags.OnlyTextTagMixin[source]

Bases: object

This mixin class ensures that only text nodes can be added to the tag.

tag_name

The name of the tag.

Type:

str

add_node_validation(new_node: HTML) → None[source]
tag_name: str

Базовые теги

Базовые классы и миксины для HTML тегов.

Base classes and mixins for HTML tags.

This module provides the fundamental building blocks for all HTML tags, including base classes, mixins, and utility classes that define common behavior and validation rules.

class html_codegen.tags.base_.text(text: str, /)[source]

Bases: HTML

This class represents a text node in HTML. It inherits from the HTML class.

Indicates whether this node is a text node.

Type:

bool

__init__(text: str, /) → None[source]

Initialize a text object with the given text.

Parameters:

text (str) – Text that will be set for this node.

add_node_validation(new_node: HTML) → None[source]

Check if a new HTML element can be added as a child element.

Parameters:

new_node (HTMLNode) – New HTML element

Raises:

Exception – If the new element already has a parent

class html_codegen.tags.base_.OnlyOneInHTMLTagMixin[source]

Bases: object

Mixin class that ensures a tag can only appear once within an HTML document.

This mixin validates that the tag is placed inside an HTML tag and that no other instance of the same tag already exists in the document.

tag_name: str
parent: HTML
class html_codegen.tags.base_.OnlyTextTagMixin[source]

Bases: object

This mixin class ensures that only text nodes can be added to the tag.

tag_name

The name of the tag.

Type:

str

tag_name: str
add_node_validation(new_node: HTML) → None[source]

Медиа теги

Теги для встраивания медиа контента.

Media tags.

This module provides HTML tags for embedding and displaying media content, including images, videos, audio, and other multimedia elements.

Метаданные

Теги для метаданных документа.

Metadata tags.

This module provides HTML tags for document metadata and head section elements, including title, meta, link, style, and script tags.

class html_codegen.tags.metadata_.title(text_content: str, /)[source]

Bases: OnlyTextTagMixin, Tag

This class represents a title tag in HTML. It inherits from the _OnlyTextTagMixin and _Tag classes.

Initialize a title tag object with the given text.

Parameters:

text_content (str) – Text that will be set for this tag.

Initialize a link tag object with the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • href (str) – URL that the link should point to.

  • rel (str) – Relationship between the current document and the target document.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments that will be passed to the parent class.

Примеры использования

Базовое использование

from html_codegen.tags import html, head, body, title, div, p

# Создание простого документа
with html() as doc:
    with head():
        title("Мой документ")
    with body():
        div().p().text("Привет, мир!")

Работа с атрибутами

from html_codegen.tags import div, p

# Добавление атрибутов
with div(attrs={"class": "container", "id": "main"}):
    p(attrs={"class": "highlight"}).text("Текст")

Семантические элементы

from html_codegen.tags import html, body, header, main, article, footer, h1, p

with html() as doc:
    with body():
        with header():
            h1("Заголовок")
        with main():
            with article():
                p("Содержание статьи")
        with footer():
            p("Подвал")

Формы

from html_codegen.tags import form, input_, label, button

with form(attrs={"method": "POST"}):
    label(attrs={"for": "name"}).text("Имя:")
    input_(attrs={"type": "text", "id": "name"})
    button(attrs={"type": "submit"}).text("Отправить")

Списки

from html_codegen.tags import ul, ol, li

# Маркированный список
with ul():
    li("Элемент 1")
    li("Элемент 2")

# Нумерованный список
with ol():
    li("Первый")
    li("Второй")

Таблицы

from html_codegen.tags import table, thead, tbody, tr, th, td

with table():
    with thead():
        with tr():
            th("Колонка 1")
            th("Колонка 2")
    with tbody():
        with tr():
            td("Данные 1")
            td("Данные 2")
